result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sam P Slaski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS. Case calendared for plea hearing. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue. Court takes no action on bail at this time.
Due to courts calendar, case set for plea hearing on 7/17/2017 at 1:30pm rescheduled  to 7/18/2017 at 1:30pm in Branch 11. All parties notified.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS.

Defendant Sam P Slaski in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS. CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD. Case calendared for scheduling conference. Defense informs court of possible DPA and requests time for TAD examination. Defense requests projected guilty plea/possible DPA hearing. Case adjourned for Plea hearing in Branch 11.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sam P Slaski in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Daniel Murphy for Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound the defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2017 at 08:30 am.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Defendant Sam P Slaski in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Sam P Slaski not in court.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 06-18-2015 at 01:30pm
